alert.note: Alert for Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 3:39AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following county, Tyler. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 328 AM EST, the gauge on Middle Island Creek near Middlebourne was at 15.8 feet and rising. Flooding is already occurring in portions of the warned area. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Middlebourne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
